content: Got it, I’ll stay in character. Go ahead, counselor.
It's great to meet you. Thanks for trusting this space and being open to the session. How are you feeling today?
Honestly, I feel pretty drained and overwhelmed. It’s hard to focus on anything when everything feels like it’s falling apart at home. I’m just not sure how to handle all of it anymore.

That sounds really tough, and it seems like you’ve been carrying a lot on your shoulders lately. Feeling drained and overwhelmed can make everything feel even more challenging. What's been going on at home that's making things feel so heavy for you?

Well, my son has been having some serious behavioral issues—he’s been acting out a lot, and my wife and I can’t seem to figure out how to help him. It’s been causing a lot of tension between us, and I feel like it’s driving us apart. On top of that, my daughter is doing fine, but I haven’t been present for her at all because I’m just so caught up with everything else.

It sounds like things feel really chaotic and like you're being pulled in different directions. You clearly care a lot about your family — wanting to support your son, mend things with your wife, and be there for your daughter. It’s no wonder you’re feeling so stretched. How are you taking care of yourself through all of this?
I’m not, really. I feel so weighed down that it feels impossible to think about myself when my family is falling apart. Things I used to enjoy don’t seem to matter anymore—I just feel stuck.

Feeling stuck can be so disheartening, especially when you’re giving so much to the people you love. It’s hard to think about yourself when your focus is entirely on them. Yet, deep down, it sounds like you might be longing for something to help you feel just a bit more grounded or balanced amid all this. What do you think about that?

Yeah, I guess you’re right. It’s hard to admit, but sometimes I wish I had some kind of escape or clarity to help me process everything without feeling so weighed down. I just don’t even know where to start.

Acknowledging that longing for clarity and a bit of space for yourself shows just how much you’re aware of your own needs, even when it’s hard to think about prioritizing them. Starting can feel daunting, especially when life feels this overwhelming. If you could make just one small change to help you feel a little more grounded, what might that look like?
